meanings.definition: Discrimination or prejudice against people based on their social class.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's unfair treatment of students from lower-income families showed her classist attitude.
meanings.sent2: The classist behavior of the wealthy businessman made it difficult for employees from different backgrounds to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The classist cat only wanted to play with other purebred felines.
meanings.sent4: Her classist views created an invisible barrier between her and those she deemed inferior.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as a classist who looked down on anyone not born into wealth.

meanings.definition: A person who discriminates against others based on their social class.
meanings.sent1: The classist refused to associate with anyone who didn't come from a wealthy family.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled a classist for her snobbish behavior towards those she considered beneath her.
meanings.sent3: The classist at the party only socialized with guests who drove luxury cars.
meanings.sent4: He was such a classist that he couldn't even imagine being friends with someone from a different social class.
meanings.sent5: The author painted the antagonist as a classist who looked down on the protagonist for being of humble origins.
